algorithm_technique: Iterate to find longest sequential prefix, calculate sum, use hash set for efficient lookup of missing integer.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest missing number greater than or equal to the sum of the longest sequential prefix.
problem_summary_technical: Identify the longest sequential prefix, compute its sum, and then find the smallest integer >= sum not present in the input array using a hash set.
key_insights: The problem requires identifying a specific property (sequential prefix) and then performing a search for a missing element.
A hash set is crucial for efficient O(1) average time complexity lookups when checking for the presence of numbers.
The sequential prefix check can be done in a single pass.
